subject: Re: The Ovilus
author: John F
full_text:
Below are responses to 2 different messages in this thread:

>
> I have a puck, and I have been getting the name Seth too.  I also
have had
> my puck give words that are not on the list.

> Carol B.

Thanks for letting me know. Am I right that the puck list is the same
as the Ovilus word list?



--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, suzanne bibb <suzyq6819@...> wrote:
>
> My team has not yet purchased the Ovilus but I have been told that
it has the ability to form words that have not been programmed into
it. Since I have never used one, I am wondering what are the
similarities between the Ovilus and Frank's Box. Could it be at all
possible that rather than just forming words or sounds based on
atmospheric readings, spirits are speaking through the Ovilus as they
do Frank's box? 
> 
> I don't mean to sound silly or presumptous, but I am very very
curious!! I am looking forward to purchasing the Ovilus as well as
the puck in the near future! Thanks for any feedback onthe Ovilus!
> 


The Ovilus has the ability to form words in the phonetic mode, which I
was not using. Does it have the ability to form words in the
dictionary mode? I do not know. It would seem unlikely. Can spirits
speak through the Ovilus like they do Frank's box? Maybe. Frank's box
has a lot of white noise that can possibly be manipulated by spirits
into giving us messages, but the ovilus has words programmed into it's
memory, it would probably take a lot more for entities to inject a
word into the computer's memory than to inject a word into white
noise. A lot of the words that are coming through that are not on the
list is meaningless jibberish as the ovilus detects temperature
changes and has nothing to do with the paranormal. I do not believe
that the temperture changing could manipulate the components of this
device to the degree that would be needed to actually create words
like it is doing. I am betting if enough people catalog words that it
is saying we'll probably wind up with another 500 or so beyond what it
was supposed to be capable of. 

I emailed the creator yesterday offering to send him sound files of
the words I am getting so that he can properly identify which of the
512 words these are, but so far I have not heard back from him in
regards to this.
